com.example.knockout007

Class ClientWebSocketListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • okhttp3.WebSocketListener
      • com.example.knockout007.ClientWebSocketListener

  • public class ClientWebSocketListener
extends okhttp3.WebSocketListener
    User can create an instance of the client websocket listener to "listen" in the background of an application. When the listener receives a message, it will automatically handle it. See onOpen

      ClientWebSocketListener(JSONHandlerInterface myActivity)
      Constructor for websocket listener

    • Constructor Detail

      • ClientWebSocketListener

        public ClientWebSocketListener(JSONHandlerInterface myActivity)
        Constructor for websocket listener
        Parameters:
        myActivity - The activity that will be listening for the websocket. Must implement JSONHandlerInterface, i.e. have a handler inside of it for onMessage to invoke

    • Method Detail

      • onOpen

        public void onOpen(okhttp3.WebSocket webSocket,
                   okhttp3.Response response)
        Overrides:

      • onMessage

        public void onMessage(okhttp3.WebSocket webSocket,
                      java.lang.String text)
        Invoked when the client receives any message from the server. The message is parsed and then sent into the JSONHandler of the activity tht created this instance of websocket listener
        Overrides:
        onMessage in class okhttp3.WebSocketListener
        Parameters:
        webSocket - The websocket to be used
        text - The full message to be parsed and sent to the JSONHandler of the activity

      • onMessage

        public void onMessage(okhttp3.WebSocket webSocket,
                      int code,
                      java.lang.String reason)
        Invoked when the client receives any message from the server. The message is parsed and then sent into the JSONHandler of the activity tht created this instance of websocket listener
        Parameters:
        webSocket - The websocket to be used
        code - The code of the message from the client. Used to determine the purpose of the message
        reason - The specific reason, if any, why this message was sent. Used for debugging purposes.
